The truck is loaded with pipes and partially covered with a tarp, and there is a visible gap between the flatbed and the load. This vehicle is partly visible and appears blurred, suggesting it is moving at a similar pace to the ego vehicle. The relative position and motion of this vehicle may indicate a possible lane change or could affect the ego vehicle's ability to change lanes if necessary.

Regarding traffic signs, there is a directional sign on the right side of the road indicating an upcoming right turn, which is crucial for the ego vehicle's route planning. There is also a yellow diamond-shaped sign with a left arrow and an exclamation point, warning of a left curve ahead that the ego car must prepare for after passing the truck. Another yellow diamond-shaped sign with a black symbol suggests the presence of merging traffic or another road hazard, informing the ego vehicle to be cautious or adjust its driving behavior accordingly.

On the road, orange traffic cones are lined up to the right of the ego vehicle, signaling a worksite or hazard on the side of the road. These cones indicate that the ego vehicle should maintain its position to the left to avoid the worksite or hazard. Complementing the cones, white and red striped barriers are present on the side of the road, parallel to the vehicle's path. These barriers act as a visual guide and prevent vehicles from drifting off the road, reinforcing the boundary set by the traffic cones.
